title: As a devotee, how should I see positions, awards, or recognition I get? | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: So how should a devotee handle the credits that he gets?
segments.summary: The segment introduces the question of how a devotee should handle the credits or recognition they receive.

segments.key_quote: As far as devotee is concerned, first thing he understands that the only recognition that I value is if Srila Prabhupada, Guru Parampara and Krishna, they are pleased.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that a devotee should value recognition from Srila Prabhupada, Guru Parampara, and Krishna above all else.

segments.key_quote: To please the Lord, to please the pure devotees of the Lord, to please the Vaiṣṇavas who are representing or representing the desires and wishes of a pure devotee.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of striving to please the Lord and the pure devotees.

segments.key_quote: So as far as all the other rewards are concerned, worldly rewards are concerned, or what the karmas come and give us, those things one should just, how can even, you know, all these things, you should just ignore them.
segments.summary: The speaker advises devotees to ignore worldly rewards and the results of karma.

segments.key_quote: But the spirit is, the devotee is saying that if at all in my service the Lord has given me some credit, it is due to the mercy of the Guru and Krishna, to be invested back in the service of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that any credit received by a devotee is due to the mercy of Guru and Krishna and should be reinvested in the Lord's service.

segments.key_quote: The material awards and that you get here in this material world.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how devotees within the community should appreciate each other's service, recognizing that Krishna is the ultimate doer.

segments.key_quote: Because ultimately Lord has got unlimited reasons why a neophyte is made to do big service sometimes.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how the Lord can use even a neophyte for big service for various reasons, including the burning away of anarthas.

segments.key_quote: So there is a Krishna conscious perspective to doing big things in this world and by the, among the devotees, but there is also a Maya consciousness of doing big things among the devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker differentiates between a Krishna conscious and a Maya conscious approach to doing big things, using an example of a devotee wanting to build a skyscraper.

segments.key_quote: These are all good for karmis.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the glories of Prabhupada's pure devotional service to material success, emphasizing the difference in motivation.

segments.key_quote: Only with Krishna Shakti, you can do seva for Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that only with Krishna's energy (shakti) can one truly serve Krishna and that Prabhupada was empowered by this shakti.
